We already knew that AMD is planning on joining ARM and Intel and using hybrid big dot little design in their processors. And now, a new patent has given us some insight into how team Red's hybrids will handle assigning tasks to either a big, powerful core, or a little, power efficient one. The CPU will have hardware to monitor both memory and processor utilization, both of which will be higher for more intensive tasks, as well as the memory access data rate. If those metrics are high for a particular task, the CPU can pause its first core and then move the task over to a more powerful core or vice versa if the task doesn't require as many resources.
